1.text: And he went again into the synagogue; and a man was there having the hand dried up.

2.text: And they were observing him narrowly, if in the sabbaths he will heal him; that they might accuse him.

3.text: And he says to the man having the hand dried up, Rise in the midst.

4.text: And he says to them, Is it lawful in the sabbaths to do good, or to do evil? to save a soul, or to kill? And they were silent.

5.text: And having looked round upon them with anger, grieved for the hardness of their heart, he says to the man, Stretch out thy hand. And he stretched out: and his hand was restored whole as the other.

6.text: And the Pharisees having come out, quickly with the Herodians were making counsel against him, that they might destroy him.

7.text: And Jesus withdrew with, his disciples to the sea: and a great multitude from Galilee followed him, and from Judea,

8.text: And from Jerusalem, and from Idumea, and beyond Jordan; and they about Tyre and Sidon, a great multitude, having heard what he did, came to him.

9.text: And he said to his disciples, that a small vessel should remain for him, on account of the crowd, that they might not press him.

10.text: For he cured many; so as to fall upon him that they might touch him, as many as had plagues.

11.text: And unclean spirits, when they saw him, fell before him, and cried, saying, That thou art the Son of God.

12.text: And he censured them much, lest they should make him manifest.

13.text: And he goes up to a mountain, and calls whom he would: and they came to him.

14.text: And he made the twelve, that they might be with him, and that he might send them forth to proclaim,

15.text: And have power to cure diseases, and cast out demons:

16.text: And he set to Simon the name Peter;

17.text: And James, him of Zebedee, and John brother of James; and he set to them names Boanerges, which is, Sons of thunder:

18.text: And Andrew, and Philip, and Bartholomew, and Matthew, and Thomas, and James him of Alpheus, and Thaddeus, and Simon the Canaanite,

19.text: And Judas Iscariot, who also delivered him up.

20.text: And they came into the house; and again came the crowd together, so that they could not even eat bread.

21.text: And they with him, having heard, came forth to take hold of him: for they said, That he is affected in mind.

22.text: And the scribes, they having come down from Jerusalem, said, That he has Beelzeboul, and that by the ruler of demons he casts out demons.

23.text: And having called them, in parables spake he to them, How can Satan cast out Satan.

24.text: And if a kingdom be divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.

25.text: And if a house be divided against itself, that house cannot stand.

26.text: And if Satan rise up against himself, and has been divided, he cannot stand, but has an end.

27.text: None can plunder the vessels of the strong, having entered his house, except he first bind the strong; then he will plunder his house.

28.text: Truly I say to you, That all sins shall be remitted to the sons of men, and defamations whatever they defame:

29.text: And whoever should defame against the Holy Spirit has no remission forever, but he is liable to the penalty of eternal condemnation.

30.text: For they said, He has an unclean spirit.

31.text: Then came his brethren and his mother, and, standing without, they sent to him, calling him.

32.text: And the crowd sat about him, and they said to him, Behold, thy mother and thy brethren without seek thee.

33.text: And he answered them, saying, Who is my mother, and my brethren?

34.text: And having looked round upon those sitting round about him, he says, Behold my mother and my brethren!

35.text: For whoever should do the will of God, he is my brother, and my sister, and mother.
